turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Concealed carry.
turn.1: What is the law about concealed carry in the UK?
turn.2: Concealed or open carry of any weapon is generally prohibited in Great Britain (i.e.
turn.4: England, Wales, and Scotland), the Prevention of Crime Act 1953 prohibiting this in a "public place".
turn.6: Permission exists only with lawful authority or reasonable excuse.
turn.7: what is the definition of an offensive weapon?
turn.8: As per Section 1(4) Prevention of Crime Act 1953, the definition of an offensive weapon is: "“offensive weapon” means any article made or adapted for use for causing injury to the person, or intended by the person having it with him for such use by him or by some other person".
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Self defence is no longer considered a legitimate reason for the granting of a Firearms Certificate (FAC) in Great Britain.
turn.11: why is self defence not a reason?
turn.12: Unlike Great Britain, Northern Ireland still allows the carry of concealed handguns for the purpose of self defence.
